CatDescriptText: Mr. Henry Gatewood, mail handler PRR, 1820 Wylie Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think waitresses should be paid a minimum of $1 per hour plus tips?" answer reads: "I say yes, they should get the $1 an hour minimum. The courtesy the give is worth it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Henry Gatewood wearing light colored short sleeve t-shirt, standing on sidewalk with automobiles, buildings, and billboard in background
